project_name: UPM-Replace Ph1 Chiller Condenser Circuit PD Switches
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: During the Phase 1 chilled water rebalance energy saving project the chiller condensed pressure differential switches were found not to be operating reliably
scope_of_work.scope: Replace Condensed Water PD switches on Chillers 1, 2 & 3
scope_of_work.justification: To ensure maximum chiller reliability and equipment protection & reduce risk of component failures. The switch function is to confirm correct water flow through the chiller in it's enabling circuit before the chiller commences a cooling cycle to meet the set point. In the event of a low flow condition, the PD switches shut down the chiller.

scope_of_work.problem: Primary chilled water pump replacement due to not being done during the RER project due to IBM funding and is now coming to the end of its working life
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction
Sign relevant paperwork 
Remove the existing Worthington Simpson belt drive pump
Install 1no Grundfos NB end suction pump to be supplied by customer
Remove existing pipework and NRVs, back to the current Isolation Valves
Install all new pipework, bellows, NRVs and gasket, to be supplied by customer
Make all mechanical and electrical connections
Test and commission
Arrange for the lagging to be reinstalled or replaced where necessary
scope_of_work.justification:
To complete upgrade works to chilled water pumps started during RER project and stopped due to IBM funding. 
To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989"
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick - PH1 Fuel Leak Investigation
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Upon running the Phase 1 Generators we found that the fuel pipework in the Bulk oil store had developed a leak which looks to have back filled into the bunded pipework across the service road, we assume that this has filled up and found the first release point into the Bulk store area. The pipework in question tops up the day tanks so we do not run low on fuel in the event 
of a fault to site where generators would be called upon to run and manage site load, or in the monthly maintaining of the generators when we run them
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply Scaffolding
2x engineers will then 
Drill a hole on the outer bunded pipe to drain oil that has leaked into the bund
Undo 12 bolt flange and investigate pipe work to find the leak.
Clean up Spill in the tank room
Investigate pipework for leak
Complete after-works report
scope_of_work.justification:
If we do not do a repair on the area the pipework is leaking, we would struggle to top up the day tanks in the event of a mains failure to site or in the running of maintenance on the generators. If we did try to run the fuel from the main tank to the day tank we would then be 
faced with the fuel leaking from high level and it would then have the potential to create an environmental issue as it would be hard to contain due to it tracking across containment below the pipework and finding different routes / location's to drip down from.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
If we do not do a repair on the area the pipework is leaking, we would struggle to top up the day tanks in the event of a mains failure to site or in the running of maintenance on the generators. If we did try to run the fuel from the main tank to the day tank we would then be 
faced with the fuel leaking from high level and it would then have the potential to create an environmental issue as it would be hard to contain due to it tracking across containment below the pipework and fnding different routes / location's to drip down from.

project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick - Remove and Change Pipework
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: PH1 Bulk Oil Store has deteriorated  pipework from the fuel storage tank which feeds PH1A generators. This pipework requires removing and replacing with new. The pipework is single skinned due to it being within the bunded area. Their are now certain areas where it has started to weep, this already has had a temporary fix by or on site techs, but now requires faulty section's  of pipework to be removed and replaced.
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply RAMS
2 x Engineers 
Remove redundant pipework
Supply and Fit 2-inch mapres S/S pipework to replace leaking pipework (12 Meters)
1 x inline mesh filter brass
Complete after works report
scope_of_work.justification: If the pipework is not replaced with new this could lead to larger issues, as in when the PH1A generators are called for to run, the pipework could going forward have worsened and create a split in where the fuel doesn't reach them and spills all into the bunded area within the bulk store. This then creates an environmental issue, as well as not having the ability to back up PH1A generators with fuel called for which would stop them running as they are diesel run engines.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: If the pipework is not replaced with new this could lead to larger issues, as in when the PH1A generators are called for to run, the pipework could going forward have worsened and create a split in where the fuel doesn't reach them and spills all into the bunded area within the bulk store. This then creates an environmental issue, as well as not having the ability to back up PH1A generators with fuel called for which would stop them running as they are diesel run engines.

project_name: UPM-Ph1A AHU Control & Intake Motor Failure
status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: During a Mains Fail test the Ph1A AHU had a control circuit fault resulting in switchgear/starter damage and intake fan motor failure
scope_of_work.scope: Investigation and rectification of control circuit fault. Temporary fix to get AHU operational on supply 2, replace supply 1 intake motor with free issue VSD to improve control and motor circuit protection and to give provision to make considerable energy savings, install 2 new VSDs for corresponding extract fans to enable reduction in running system power
scope_of_work.justification: Ph1A AHU provides humidity control and required air changes to Ph1A DC suites C, D & E. Running cost is approx £75K and a minimum annual saving of 20% is expected thus supports replacement of damage starter controls with new  VSD drives as the rest of the site pumps and AHUs motor control soft start and improved close motor protection
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Required humidity and air changes will not be met. Energy saving initiative will not be achieved.
